awd_titl_txt: A Conference on Pulsating Stars and Fundamental Problems    in Astronomy
awd_abstract_narration: The meeting supported by this grant aims to bring together                      specialists on stellar pulsation and those astronomers who use                  the pulsating stars to study stellar evolution, galactic                        morphology and evolution, and the cosmic distance scale.                                                                                                        Many aging stars pulsate regularly.  Their pulsation has been                   valuable for establishing and checking models of stellar                        evolution.  Pulsating stars have also provided an important                     method for determining astronomical distances within our Galaxy                 and to the nearer other galaxies.  But this information is only                 as accurate as are the models of stellar pulsation used to                      interpret the data.  This conference will bring together experts                on all these subjects so that they can jointly determine the                    accomplishments, uncertainties, and opportunities in this                       subject.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
